data.title: Comedian Martin Lawrence announces stand-up tour, here’s how to get tickets
data.meta_description: See Martin Lawrence in Detroit on Friday, August 30 and/or Grand Rapids on Saturday, August 31; tickets now available for both the Little Caesars and Van Andel Arena shows.
data.text:
See Martin Lawrence in Detroit on Friday, August 30 and/or Grand Rapids on Saturday, August 31; tickets now available for both the Little Caesars and Van Andel Arena shows.

Purchase yours on Vivid Seats and StubHub.

Martin Lawrence, best known for his stand-up performances and acting roles in the “Bad Boys” movies, “Big Momma’s House,” as well as 90s sitcom “Martin,” recently announced his first comedy tour in almost a decade. It kicks off this July in Arizona, and is set to hit nearby venues the Rocket Mortgage Fieldhouse in Cleveland, Ohio on August 3, the Little Caesars Arena in Detroit, Michigan on August 30, and Grand Rapids’ Van Andel Arena the following night, August 31.

Tickets for the upcoming “Y’all Know What It Is!” tour are already selling fast. See below for pricing options.

Starting ticket prices:

Cleveland, OH - Vivid Seats from $164 | StubHub from $261

Detroit, MI - Vivid Seats from $144 | StubHub from $140
